title: AI Tool Usage Patterns

rq10a_usage_frequency.finding: ChatGPT is most widely adopted (63.7% active users, M=3.01)

rq10b_population_comparison.description: Role Type comparison (Academic vs Professional vs Leader)
rq10b_population_comparison.analysis_method: One-way ANOVA with Tukey HSD post-hoc

key_patterns.ChatGPT: Academic ≈ Leader (M≈3.4); both higher than Professional (M=2.39)
key_patterns.MSCopilot: Leaders dominate (M=3.46) >> Academic (2.33) > Professional (2.04); η²=.159 LARGE effect

rq10b_population_comparison.finding: Leaders dominate ALL tools with large effect sizes; Professionals show LOWEST usage

rq10c_construct_correlations.description: Correlations between usage and AIRS constructs
rq10c_construct_correlations.finding: All correlations significant (p<.01); Total usage strongly predicts BI (ρ=0.70)

rq10d_user_types.finding: Large effects (η²>.24) for all constructs; multi-tool users score higher on all AIRS dimensions

leader_comparison.construct_effects: d=0.64-0.82 (Leaders higher on ALL AIRS constructs)
leader_comparison.finding: Leaders show DISTINCTLY HIGHER adoption readiness than Professionals - NOT similar patterns. Leadership is a meaningful moderator of AI adoption.

criterion_validity_evidence: Strong - current usage validates AIRS construct measures
